LayoutNode.Content: Using Every Door Direct Mail
LayoutNode.SRC: Using Every Door Direct Mail

LayoutNode.Content: What is EDDM? USPS® Every Door Direct Mail® (EDDM®) is an affordable targeted advertising technique that lets you map your marketing mail audience by age, income, or household size 2 . You can use the EDDM mapping tool to choose the ZIP Code™ and carrier route that will target your best possible customers—current and future. The EDDM mapping tool is easy to use and discounts are available even for small businesses. Price – USPS Marketing Mail™ Flats up to 3.3 oz EDDM Retail® USPS Marketing Flats $0.178 per piece EDDM BMEU USPS Marketing Mail at $0.157 per piece EDDM Mapping Tool
LayoutNode.SRC:
What is EDDM?

USPS® Every Door Direct Mail® (EDDM®) is an affordable targeted advertising technique that lets you map your marketing mail audience by age, income, or household size2. You can usethe EDDM mapping tool to choose the ZIP Code™ and carrier route that will target your best possible customers—current and future. The EDDM mapping tool is easy to use and discountsare available even for small businesses.Price – USPS Marketing Mail™ Flats up to 3.3 ozEDDM Retail® USPS Marketing Flats $0.178 per pieceEDDM BMEU USPS Marketing Mail at $0.157 per pieceEDDM Mapping Tool

LayoutNode.Content: Get Started Now – Two Options
LayoutNode.SRC: Get Started Now – Two Options

LayoutNode.Content: You can create your EDDM order yourself or get help with design, printing, and mail preparation and drop-off using USPS affiliate vendors.
LayoutNode.SRC: You can create your EDDM order yourself or get help with design, printing, and mail preparation and drop-off using USPS affiliate vendors.

LayoutNode.Content: EDDM – Do It Yourself Ready to save money? Learn how to prepare an EDDM mailing, options, and tips for reaching potential customers quickly and effectively. Learn More
LayoutNode.SRC:
EDDM – Do It Yourself

Ready to save money? Learn how to prepare an EDDM mailing, options, and tips for reaching potential customers quickly and effectively.

Learn More

LayoutNode.Content: EDDM – Online Design & Printing Help Let USPS affiliate 1 printers and mailing experts help you save time and focus your ad campaign and marketing dollars with memorable mail. Learn More
LayoutNode.SRC:
EDDM – Online Design & Printing Help

Let USPS affiliate1 printers and mailing experts help you save time and focus your ad campaign and marketing dollars with memorable mail.Learn More

LayoutNode.Content: Creating an EDDM Mailing
LayoutNode.SRC: Creating an EDDM Mailing

LayoutNode.Content: Create a USPS Account Set up your USPS EDDM or Business Account to get started. About USPS EDDM & Business Accounts Select Your Routes Choose the carrier routes on the EDDM Mapping tool where you think your customers live. The EDDM User Guide illustrates and explains all the steps for choosing delivery routes. EDDM Mapping Tool EDDM User Guide PDF (5.1 MB) | RTF (0.5 MB) Create a Mailpiece Select the right type and size mailpiece for EDDM advertising. Choose a clean design with a clear message. Offering a discount with your campaign helps brings in new customers. Online Direct Mail Experts NOTE: USPS® assumes no liability for the results of any contact with any company listed. Private vendors may apply non-USPS charges. Find a Printer Online direct mail specialists and some local printers can help format and design, as well as print, your mailpiece. Online Experts & Local Printers Choose Your Drop Off Date You can pay for your mailing online or at the Post Office™ where you drop it off. Select your drop-off date based on how many deliveries you want and where you plan to send them.The EDDM User Guide explains the drop-off steps and options for Retail and Business Mail Entry Unit (BMEU) accounts. EDDM User Guide PDF (5.1 MB) | RTF (0.5 MB) Prepare Mailing Bundles Bundle your mailing in stacks of 50-100 mailpieces. Bundles may not be higher than 6 inches. Direct mail specialists can prepare your mailing as part of your order. Fill Out Processing Forms Facing slips and EDDM forms tell the Postal Service™ how to process and deliver your order. Attach a facing slip to the top of every bundle. If a customer wants to be removed from your mailings, include the customer's address in the "Do Not Deliver Address" column on the facing slip. Write the number of pieces in the bundle on the facing slip. EDDM Postal Forms Pay for Postage Pay with a free USPS.com® account online or pay at the Post Office™. Charges are based on the type of account you have and the size of your mailing. EDDM Postage Submit Your Mailing Take or send your mailing to a Post Office for delivery.

Select your drop-off date based on how many deliveries you want and where you plan to send them.The EDDM User Guide explains the drop-off steps and options for Retail and Business Mail Entry Unit (BMEU) accounts.EDDM User Guide PDF (5.1 MB) | RTF (0.5 MB)Prepare Mailing BundlesBundle your mailing in stacks of 50-100 mailpieces. Bundles may not be higher than 6 inches. Direct mail specialists can prepare your mailing as part of your order.Fill Out Processing FormsFacing slips and EDDM forms tell the Postal Service™ how to process and deliver your order. Attach a facing slip to the top of every bundle. If a customer wants to be removed fromyour mailings, include the customer's address in the "Do Not Deliver Address" column on the facing slip. Write the number of pieces in the bundle on the facing slip.EDDM Postal FormsPay for PostagePay with a free USPS.com® account online or pay at the Post Office™. LayoutNode.Content: Designing & Printing Mailpieces
LayoutNode.SRC: Designing & Printing Mailpieces

LayoutNode.Content: Send Actionable Mail
LayoutNode.SRC: Send Actionable Mail

LayoutNode.Content: Choose Your Mailpiece Size EDDM mailings use USPS Marketing Mail™ Flats. Pick the size, weight, and type of flat that will work with your offer. You can check your mailpiece's size with the Mailpiece SizeRequirements Tool in the EDDM online mapping tool. USPS Marketing Mail (formerly Standard Mail) Flat Sizes Design Your Mailpiece If you want to generate leads or business with an offer, use mailpiece copy and design to present your offer clearly and prominently. Format Your Mailpiece for Printing Make sure your design includes the address label and postage indicia in the right locations for an EDDM mailing. Many printers can help you format, design, print, and prepare yourmailing using the correct USPS® formats and postage marks. EDDM Retail Fact Sheet PDF (248 KB) | RTF (50 KB) Mailing & Printing Specialists
LayoutNode.SRC: Choose Your Mailpiece SizeEDDM mailings use USPS Marketing Mail™ Flats. Pick the size, weight, and type of flat that will work with your offer. You can check your mailpiece's size with the Mailpiece SizeRequirements Tool in the EDDM online mapping tool.USPS Marketing Mail (formerly Standard Mail) Flat SizesDesign Your MailpieceIf you want to generate leads or business with an offer, use mailpiece copy and design to present your offer clearly and prominently.Format Your Mailpiece for PrintingMake sure your design includes the address label and postage indicia in the right locations for an EDDM mailing. Many printers can help you format, design, print, and prepare yourmailing using the correct USPS® formats and postage marks. EDDM Retail Fact Sheet PDF (248 KB) | RTF (50 KB)Mailing & Printing Specialists

LayoutNode.Content: USPS & EDDM Business Accounts The Postal Service has two types of accounts for EDDM mailings. The account that is better for your business depends on the size and frequency of your mailings. Every Door Direct Mail-Retail® Account Most local businesses choose our Every Door Direct Mail-Retail® (EDDM Retail®) service, which allows up to 5,000 mailpieces a day per ZIP Code. EDDM Retail accounts use the EDDMRetail Indicia and do not need to purchase a postage permit. Open EDDM Retail (USPS.com) Account USPS Business Account With a USPS business account you can save time and money by managing your mailings online. Mailings of more than 5,000 mailpieces per 5–digit ZIP Code per day require a postage permit.Large mailings must be dropped off at a Business Mail Entry Unit (BMEU) or Postal Service™ facility that accepts bulk and permit mail. Open USPS Business Account
LayoutNode.SRC:
USPS & EDDM Business Accounts

The Postal Service has two types of accounts for EDDM mailings. The account that is better for your business depends on the size and frequency of your mailings.

Every Door Direct Mail-Retail® Account

Most local businesses choose our Every Door Direct Mail-Retail® (EDDM Retail®) service, which allows up to 5,000 mailpieces a day per ZIP Code. EDDM Retail accounts use the EDDMRetail Indicia and do not need to purchase a postage permit.Open EDDM Retail (USPS.com) Account

USPS Business Account

With a USPS business account you can save time and money by managing your mailings online. Mailings of more than 5,000 mailpieces per 5–digit ZIP Code per day require a postage permit.Large mailings must be dropped off at a Business Mail Entry Unit (BMEU) or Postal Service™ facility that accepts bulk and permit mail.Open USPS Business Account

LayoutNode.Content: Tips for EDDM Mailings Expand All FAQs Collapse All
LayoutNode.SRC:
Tips for EDDM Mailings

Expand All FAQsCollapse All

LayoutNode.Content: EDDM Postage Expand Collapse FAQ question
LayoutNode.SRC: EDDM Postage ExpandCollapse FAQ question

LayoutNode.Content: EDDM Price & Postage
LayoutNode.SRC: EDDM Price & Postage

LayoutNode.Content: The Every Door Direct Mail-Retail price per piece for Flats weighing no more than 3.3 oz is $0.178.
LayoutNode.SRC: The Every Door Direct Mail-Retail price per piece for Flats weighing no more than 3.3 oz is $0.178.

LayoutNode.Content: EDDM Retail Customers You do not have to have a mailing permit to use EDDM Retail. Retail customers may pay for mailings online with a credit/debit card or at the Post Office™ with cash, credit/debit card,check, or meter strip. EDDM BMEU® (Business Mail Entry Unit) Customers BMEU customers must pay for mailings with a bulk-mailing permit. Drop off your EDDM mailings at the BMEU where your permit is held.
LayoutNode.SRC: EDDM Retail CustomersYou do not have to have a mailing permit to use EDDM Retail. Retail customers may pay for mailings online with a credit/debit card or at the Post Office™ with cash, credit/debit card,check, or meter strip.EDDM BMEU® (Business Mail Entry Unit) CustomersBMEU customers must pay for mailings with a bulk-mailing permit. Drop off your EDDM mailings at the BMEU where your permit is held.

LayoutNode.Content: Postage Permits A permit imprint indicia is a postage payment mark that authorized mailers may use instead of a postage or meter stamp.
LayoutNode.SRC: Postage PermitsA permit imprint indicia is a postage payment mark that authorized mailers may use instead of a postage or meter stamp.

LayoutNode.Content: EDDM Retail customers may use the Every Door Direct Mail-Retail indicia. EDDM BMEU customers may use an existing permit indicia.
LayoutNode.SRC:
• EDDM Retail customers may use the Every Door Direct Mail-Retail indicia.
  • EDDM BMEU customers may use an existing permit indicia.

LayoutNode.Content: Every Door Direct Mail-Retail Indicia Guidelines
LayoutNode.SRC: Every Door Direct Mail-Retail Indicia Guidelines

LayoutNode.Content: Every EDDM mailpiece must have an EDDM indicia with “ECRWSS” in the address area, within the permit indicia, or below the permit, like the examples to the right. The EDDM Retail Indicia does not have a specific size requirement but must be larger than .5" x .5". The type font must be in all caps and at least a 4 point size. Place the indicia in the upper right hand corner of the mailpiece. It should fit in the area 1.625" from the right edge and 1.375" from top edge. Leave 1/8" of space around the top and right edge.
LayoutNode.SRC:
• Every EDDM mailpiece must have an EDDM indicia with “ECRWSS” in the address area, within the permit indicia, or below the permit, like the examples to the right.
  • The EDDM Retail Indicia does not have a specific size requirement but must be larger than .5" x .5".
  • The type font must be in all caps and at least a 4 point size.
  • Place the indicia in the upper right hand corner of the mailpiece.
  • It should fit in the area 1.625" from the right edge and 1.375" from top edge.
  • Leave 1/8" of space around the top and right edge.

LayoutNode.Content: BMEU Address Label Guidelines
LayoutNode.SRC: BMEU Address Label Guidelines

LayoutNode.Content: "EDDM" must be included after "ECRWSS" on the address label if the mailpiece is 10.5" to 11.5" long. Including City, State, and 5-Digit ZIP Code is recommended but not required.
LayoutNode.SRC:
• "EDDM" must be included after "ECRWSS" on the address label if the mailpiece is 10.5" to 11.5" long.
  • Including City, State, and 5-Digit ZIP Code is recommended but not required.

LayoutNode.Content: EDDM Payment Options Expand Collapse FAQ question
LayoutNode.SRC: EDDM Payment Options ExpandCollapse FAQ question

LayoutNode.Content: Paying for EDDM Retail® Mailings
LayoutNode.SRC: Paying for EDDM Retail® Mailings

LayoutNode.Content: Paying Online
LayoutNode.SRC: Paying Online

LayoutNode.Content: Use the EDDM Online Tool to create your mailing. On the “Select Drop-Off Date & Payment Options” screen, select Pay Online . Pay with a credit card. Your order documentation includes a proof of payment receipt. Present your receipt when you deliver your mailing to the Post Office.
LayoutNode.SRC:
• Use the EDDM Online Tool to create your mailing.
    • On the “Select Drop-Off Date & Payment Options” screen, select Pay Online.
  • Pay with a credit card.
  • Your order documentation includes a proof of payment receipt.
  • Present your receipt when you deliver your mailing to the Post Office.

LayoutNode.Content: Paying at the Post Office
LayoutNode.SRC: Paying at the Post Office

LayoutNode.Content: Use the EDDM Online Tool to create your mailing. On the “Select Drop-Off Date & Payment Options” screen, select Pay at Post Office . Your order documentation will show the order is unpaid. Includes a proof of payment receipt. When you deliver your mailing to the Post Office, you can pay by cash, credit card, debit card, or check.
LayoutNode.SRC:
• Use the EDDM Online Tool to create your mailing.
    • On the “Select Drop-Off Date & Payment Options” screen, select Pay at Post Office.
  • Your order documentation will show the order is unpaid.
  • Includes a proof of payment receipt.
  • When you deliver your mailing to the Post Office, you can pay by cash, credit card, debit card, or check.

LayoutNode.Content: EDDM Addresses Expand Collapse FAQ question
LayoutNode.SRC: EDDM Addresses ExpandCollapse FAQ question

LayoutNode.Content: Address Lists You do not need a mailing list for an EDDM mailing. Your mail is delivered to every address on your chosen postal routes. Simplified Addressing The EDDM service uses simplified addressing instead of a full address. For example, most mailpieces will simply be addressed to "Postal Customer."
LayoutNode.SRC: Address ListsYou do not need a mailing list for an EDDM mailing. Your mail is delivered to every address on your chosen postal routes.Simplified AddressingThe EDDM service uses simplified addressing instead of a full address. For example, most mailpieces will simply be addressed to "Postal Customer."

LayoutNode.Content: Delivering Mailings to the Post Office Expand Collapse FAQ question
LayoutNode.SRC: Delivering Mailings to the Post Office ExpandCollapse FAQ question

LayoutNode.Content: You can take your mailing to nearby Post Offices or send them to any US Post Office for delivery to your EDDM routes.
LayoutNode.SRC: You can take your mailing to nearby Post Offices or send them to any US Post Office for delivery to your EDDM routes.

LayoutNode.Content: Dropping Off Your Mailing at a Post Office
LayoutNode.SRC: Dropping Off Your Mailing at a Post Office

LayoutNode.Content: In the EDDM mapping tool, choose your EDDM delivery routes. The Order Summary will show your payment and Post Office options.
LayoutNode.SRC: In the EDDM mapping tool, choose your EDDM delivery routes. The Order Summary will show your payment and Post Office options.

LayoutNode.Content: Bundle your mailing in stacks of 50-100 mailpieces. Bundles may not be higher than 6". Attach a completed EDDM Retail Facing Slip with Carrier Route Information (PDF | 48 KB) to every bundle. Write the number of pieces in the bundle on the facing slip. Include a completed Every Door Direct Mail (EDDM) Retail® form (PS Form 3587 - PDF | 19 KB) . Note: Be sure to fill in the carrier route information on the back. Take the mailing to the Post Office for your selected ZIP Code.
LayoutNode.SRC:
• Bundle your mailing in stacks of 50-100 mailpieces. Bundles may not be higher than 6".
    • Attach a completed EDDM Retail Facing Slip with Carrier Route Information (PDF | 48 KB) to every bundle. Write the number of pieces in the bundle on the facing slip.Include a completed Every Door Direct Mail (EDDM) Retail® form (PS Form 3587 - PDF | 19 KB). Note: Be sure to fill in the carrier route information on the back.
  • Take the mailing to the Post Office for your selected ZIP Code.

LayoutNode.Content: Shipping Your Mailing to a Post Office
LayoutNode.SRC: Shipping Your Mailing to a Post Office

LayoutNode.Content: EDDM Retail Customers
LayoutNode.SRC: EDDM Retail Customers

LayoutNode.Content: If you want your EDDM mailing sent to a distant ZIP Code, send your mailing by Priority Mail® to the Postmaster for that route.
LayoutNode.SRC: If you want your EDDM mailing sent to a distant ZIP Code, send your mailing by Priority Mail® to the Postmaster for that route.

LayoutNode.Content: Bundle your mailing in stacks of 50-100 mailpieces. Bundles may not be higher than 6". Attach a completed EDDM Retail Facing Slip with Carrier Route Information (PDF | 48 KB) to every bundle. Place bundles with attached facing slips in a box. USPS Shipping Boxes Place an envelope containing the following in the box: Sample mailpiece If you haven't paid for your order online, include a check or money order made out to "Postmaster" or "Postal Service" for the amount of postage for your mailing. Include yourtelephone number on the front of the check. Every Door Direct Mail (EDDM) Retail® form (PS Form 3587 - PDF | 19 KB) Postmaster Instruction Letter (PDF | 23 KB) Address your boxes to "Postmaster" at the Post Office you're shipping to. POSTMASTER CITY, ST 22222 Write "Every Door Direct Mail–Retail" and "Open Immediately" on each box. Label and number the boxes. For multiple boxes, number them as "1 of X", with "X" being the total number of boxes. Example: "1 of 5," "2 of 5," etc.
LayoutNode.SRC:
• Bundle your mailing in stacks of 50-100 mailpieces. Bundles may not be higher than 6".
    • Attach a completed EDDM Retail Facing Slip with Carrier Route Information (PDF | 48 KB) to every bundle.Place bundles with attached facing slips in a box.USPS Shipping BoxesPlace an envelope containing the following in the box:
  • Sample mailpiece
  • If you haven't paid for your order online, include a check or money order made out to "Postmaster" or "Postal Service" for the amount of postage for your mailing. Include your telephone number on the front of the check.
    • Every Door Direct Mail (EDDM) Retail® form (PS Form 3587 - PDF | 19 KB)Postmaster Instruction Letter (PDF | 23 KB)Address your boxes to "Postmaster" at the Post Office you're shipping to.POSTMASTERCITY, ST 22222
  • Write "Every Door Direct Mail–Retail" and "Open Immediately" on each box.
  • Label and number the boxes. For multiple boxes, number them as "1 of X", with "X" being the total number of boxes. Example: "1 of 5," "2 of 5," etc.

LayoutNode.Content: EDDM BMEU Customers
LayoutNode.SRC: EDDM BMEU Customers

LayoutNode.Content: If you're a business planning larger mailings, you can save money using a mailing permit and dropping your mailings off at a Business Mail Entry Unit (BMEU). BMEU customers can sendEDDM mailings to multiple Post Offices using the Priority Mail Open and Distribute® service.
LayoutNode.SRC: If you're a business planning larger mailings, you can save money using a mailing permit and dropping your mailings off at a Business Mail Entry Unit (BMEU). BMEU customers can send EDDM mailings to multiple Post Offices using the Priority Mail Open and Distribute® service.

LayoutNode.Content: USPS Business Accounts Prepare your mailing according to EDDM BMEU guidelines. The EDDM confirmation page will list the forms you will need. All orders need these forms: USPS Marketing Mail Postage Statement PS Form 3602-R (PDF | 78 KB) or Non-Profit Postage Statement PS Form 3602-N (PDF | 83 KB) Plant-Verified Drop Shipment (PVDA) Verification and Clearance form PS Form 8125 (PDF | 61 KB) EDDM BMEU Facing Slip (PDF | 34 KB)
LayoutNode.SRC:
USPS Business Accounts
  • Prepare your mailing according to EDDM BMEU guidelines.
  • The EDDM confirmation page will list the forms you will need. All orders need these forms:
    • USPS Marketing Mail Postage Statement PS Form 3602-R (PDF | 78 KB) orNon-Profit Postage Statement PS Form 3602-N (PDF | 83 KB)Plant-Verified Drop Shipment (PVDA) Verification and Clearance form PS Form 8125 (PDF | 61 KB)EDDM BMEU Facing Slip (PDF | 34 KB)
